item.title: When the Career Ladder Kills Your Passion
item.content:encoded: Climbing the ladder can look like progress, yet quietly drain the spark that brought you into design. Here's how empathy helps you turn passion into purpose.

item.title: Coding Azure 21: Managing Configuration Information with App Configuration
item.content:encoded: Let’s create and configure an App Configuration service to provide shared storage of information that various components of a loosely coupled application can reference.

item.title: Next Productivity Leap: Telerik and Kendo UI 2026 Q1 Release Is Here
item.content:encoded: With new agentic tools for document processing workflows, enhanced MCP tools and a new set of AI‑ready UI components, the 2026 Q1 release lets you bring intelligence directly into your applications using the same .NET and JavaScript components you already rely on.

item.title: Building a Real-Time Security Monitoring Dashboard with Telerik UI for WinForms
item.content:encoded: See how Telerik UI for WinForms components, like charts, maps, gauges and context menus, can easily compose a security monitoring dashboard.

item.title: Ultimate Angular Firebase Setup with AnalogJS
item.content:encoded: Streamline your Angular setup with this build! Using Angular 20+, signals, AnalogJS, pure Firebase, Firestore Lite and clean injection tokens, we can get rolling with ease.

item.title: How to Build a NestJS API for Full-Text Search with OpenSearch
item.content:encoded: OpenSearch is an open-source search library that simplifies analysis of large volumes of data and result tuning. See how to create a NestJS API with this full-text search capability.

item.title: Creating Drag-and-Drop ListBoxes in Blazor
item.content:encoded: See how the Telerik UI for Blazor ListBox makes implementing dragging and dropping items between lists easy—based on a real-life case!

item.title: Optimizing JavaScript for the Edge Runtime
item.content:encoded: While the Edge runtime has limited functionality, it’s a powerful solution in the right circumstances. Here’s when it can serve your JavaScript app well.

item.title: jQuery 4.0.0 Support: What’s New and How Kendo UI Has You Covered
item.content:encoded: Hello, world, from jQuery 4! Take a look at the noteworthy changes and see how to get up to date with the framework and with Kendo UI for jQuery.

item.title: AI Crash Course: AI, ML, LLM and More
item.content:encoded: If you (like many) feel that you might have “missed the on-ramp” or if you’ve been tentatively working with AI in your applications without truly understanding what’s happening behind the scenes: you’re in the right place! To start off, we’re going to make sure we’re all on the same page in terms of terminology.

item.title: Exploring Compiled Bindings in .NET MAUI
item.content:encoded: Learn about compiled bindings in .NET MAUI and how they affect performance and debugging.

item.title: Image Optimization in Angular Applications
item.content:encoded: In this guide, we will see how to use Angular’s NgOptimizedImage directive to address some common image optimization concerns effortlessly.

item.title: Customizing Validation Messages in Blazor Forms
item.content:encoded: These Blazor components can help you create custom form experiences, so users feel right at home inside your app.

item.title: Dumpster Dashboards: Why ‘Data-Driven’ Can Be Meaningless
item.content:encoded: Most dashboards drown teams in data. Design dashboards that turn raw signals into decisions, moving from information to action with a real drilling example.

item.title: Pure Surreal Database Authentication in Nuxt
item.content:encoded: See how Nuxt pairs up with Surreal Database with a sample app enabling login, register, logout and password change options with route guards and server-safe APIs.
